intro: Dampiera conospermoides, commonly known as the narrow-leaf damperia, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in heathlands and coastal areas. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pale pink, bloom in spring and are visited by various pollinators. Dampiera conospermoides is a low-growing perennial that thrives in well-drained conditions and is often used in native garden landscaping.
